articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Russia launched another prolonged drone attack on Ukraine, killing one person and damaging swathes of Kyiv as well as striking a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's latest drone strikes hit Kyiv, maternity ward in Odesa, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police declared all of downtown Los Angeles to be an unlawful assembly area and ordered protesters to go home after a third day of violence hit demonstrations against President Donald Trump's immigration policy.
articles.title: Los Angeles police order immigration protesters in downtown to go home

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: U.N. experts said in a report on Tuesday that Israel committed the crime against humanity of "extermination" by killing civilians sheltering in schools and religious sites in Gaza, part of a "concerted campaign to obliterate Palestinian life."
articles.title: Israel commits 'extermination' in Gaza by killing in schools, UN experts say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five people have been killed in an attack at a school in the Austrian city of Graz and others were injured, Austrian media including tabloid Kronen Zeitung reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Five killed, others injured in Austrian school attack, media report

articles.author: Kate Holton, Alistair Smout
articles.description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday trade talks with China were going well as the two sides met for a second day in London, seeking a breakthrough on export controls that have threatened a fresh rupture between the superpowers.
articles.title: Lutnick says US-China trade talks going well on second day

articles.author: Hatem Khaled, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: When university professor Nizam Salama made his way to a southern Gaza aid point last week, he came under fire twice, was crushed in a desperate crowd of hungry people and finally left empty handed.
articles.title: Palestinians' dangerous ordeal to reach Israeli-approved aid

articles.author: Karen Lema, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Philippine senators were preparing to be sworn in as jurors in Wednesday's impeachment trial of Vice President Sara Duterte, who faces a lifetime political ban if convicted of high crimes and betraying the public trust.
articles.title: Philippine senators prepare to be jurors in Sara Duterte's impeachment trial

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel, the day after the Israeli navy prevented her and a group of fellow pro-Palestinian activists from sailing to Gaza.
articles.title: Greta Thunberg deported from Israel after Gaza boat seized

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has been ready to start handing over the corpses of Ukraine's war dead for several days with refrigerated trucks containing the first bodies parked near the border, but Kyiv is still discussing the details, the Kremlin said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Kremlin says it has been ready to hand over bodies of Ukrainian war dead for 'several days'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France said on Tuesday it had obtained new commitments from the Palestinian Authority to reform, ahead of a conference next week at which Paris could become the most prominent Western power to back recognition of an independent Palestinian state.
articles.title: France says it obtains Palestinian reform pledge ahead of conference
